place.name: AULT HUCKNALL
place.gazetteerText: AULT-HUCKNALL, or Hault-Hucknall, a parish in the district of Mansfield and county of Derby; on the verge of the county, adjacent to Hardwick Park, 5 miles ENE of Claycross r. station, and 6½ SE of Chesterfield. It contains the hamlets of Rowthorne and Stainsby; and its Post Town is Heath under Chesterfield. Acres, 3,730. Rated property, £3,191. Pop., 686. Houses, 134. The property is not much divided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lichfield. Value, £168.* Patron, the Duke of Devonshire. The church is good, and contains monuments to the first Countess of Devonshire and to the philosopher Hobbes. See Hardwick Hall. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
